dt: {bc}dependent on chance circumstances, unknown conditions, or uncertain developments

dt.t: … forced to earn a {wi}precarious{/wi} living as a door-to-door salesman.
Their wealth was {wi}precarious{/wi}, liable to be seized by the sultan if they fell from favour …
… the resilience of our still-evolving planet, where life is always {wi}precarious{/wi} but always tenacious.

dt: {bc}characterized by a lack of security or {d_link|stability|stability} that threatens with danger

dt.t: His balance looks {wi}precarious{/wi}, and I try to talk him down …
In spite of his {wi}precarious{/wi} emotional state, he wrote more than two dozen books …
At 82 years old, she was in {wi}precarious{/wi} health and had respiratory problems.
… a downturn in food supply could tip a {wi}precarious{/wi} balance.

If the condition of the biosphere is even half as {wi}precarious{/wi} as the environmentalists suggest, then the twenty-first century must, of necessity, abandon the theory of value so lovingly displayed in the windows of Bloomingdale's.
… the student of psychology who cares little for brilliant {wi}precarious{/wi} generalizations …

dt: {bc}depending on the will or pleasure of another

dt.t: In rank and authority these officers seemed not inferior to the ancient proconsuls; but their station was dependent and {wi}precarious{/wi}.

pt: {sc}dangerous{/sc} {sc}hazardous{/sc} {sc}precarious{/sc} {sc}perilous{/sc} {sc}risky{/sc} mean bringing or involving the chance of loss or injury. {sc}dangerous{/sc} applies to something that may cause harm or loss unless dealt with carefully.
{sc}hazardous{/sc} implies great and continuous risk of harm or failure.

pt.t: claims that smoking is {it}hazardous{/it} to your health

pt: {sc}perilous{/sc} strongly implies the immediacy of danger.
{sc}risky{/sc} often applies to a known and accepted danger.

quotes.t: These states are corrupt and brutal. They are theocracies, or {qword}precarious{/qword} autocracies, or secular totalitarian states: tyrannies all, deniers of freedom, republics of fear, enemies of civility and human flourishing.
Such folks led a {qword}precarious{/qword} existence, their homes routinely destroyed in pursuit of a scorched earth policy whenever Florence came under siege.

She was the first baby he had ever held; he had thought it would be a {qword}precarious{/qword} experience, shot through with fear of dropping something so precious and fragile, but no, in even the smallest infant there was an adhesive force, a something that actively fit your arms and hands, banishing the fear.

et: Latin {it}precārius{/it} "given as a favor, depending on the pleasure or mercy of others, of questionable force or permanence, uncertain" + {et_link|-ous|-ous} {ma}{mat|prayer:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: dependent on chance circumstances, unknown conditions, or uncertain developments
characterized by a lack of security or stability that threatens with danger
